node.title: Buying a puppy online? Watch out for scams
node.description: Police are warning people to be aware of buying puppies online after an increase in scams.
node.content:
["Police are warning people to be aware of buying puppies online after an increase in scams.", "", "
(File image) Photo: 123rf
", "Constable Kylee Coubrough said people should be careful not fall into the trap of online trading sites or fake websites that purport to be selling sought-after and popular breeds.", ""Sellers claim these puppies are fully vaccinated and potty trained, and a fake seller is likely not to let you view the puppy before purchase and claim they have their own delivery service."", "Coubrough said the scammers were also making bogus 'change of ownership' documents, which don't exist in New Zealand.", "Another red flag to watch out for is a breeder registering the puppy before you get it.", "People are advised to call 111 if they witness an illegal act or if it has already happened, you can provide information via the non-emergency police number 105.", "Police recommend the following safety tips if you're considering buying a puppy online:", "", "
A standard response from a fake puppy seller. Photo: Supplied
"]
